{"q3_revenue": "180,169", "q3_operating_income": "17,422", "q3_diluted_eps": "1.95", "q4_revenue_guidance": "206.0 - 213.0", "q4_operating_income_guidance": "21.0 - 26.0", "summary": "Amazon Q3 2025 Earnings Summary

Overview: Amazon delivered strong top-line growth in Q3 2025, with total net sales of $180.2 billion, up 13% year-over-year (12% excluding FX). Operating income was $17.4 billion, flat versus prior year, though results were impacted by $4.3 billion in special charges: a $2.5 billion FTC legal settlement and $1.8 billion in severance costs related to planned role eliminations. Excluding these charges, operating income would have been $21.7 billion. Diluted EPS was $1.95, up 36% YoY, benefiting from $9.5 billion in pre-tax gains from Anthropic investments.

Segment Performance: AWS re-accelerated to 20% YoY growth, reaching $33.0 billion in revenue with segment operating income of $11.4 billion (35% margin). Management cited strong AI and core infrastructure demand, with 3.8 gigawatts of capacity added in the past 12 months. North America sales grew 11% to $106.3 billion, with operating income of $4.8 billion ($7.3 billion excluding the FTC settlement). International sales increased 14% (10% FX-adjusted) to $40.9 billion with $1.2 billion operating income.

Growth Drivers: Advertising services grew 24% YoY to $17.7 billion. Third-party seller services increased 12% to $42.5 billion. Subscription services rose 11% to $12.6 billion. The company highlighted AI-driven improvements across operations, including Rufus (250 million customers, 60% higher purchase conversion), Trainium2 custom AI chips (150% QoQ growth), and Connect AI contact center solution ($1 billion annualized revenue run rate).

Capital Deployment: Cash capital expenditures reached $34.2 billion in Q3 2025, primarily supporting AWS infrastructure and fulfillment network expansion, with management expecting further increases in 2025-2026. Free cash flow (TTM) declined 69% to $14.8 billion due to accelerated CapEx. The company announced $2.5 billion for Future Ready 2030 workforce training and $1.9 billion investment in Delivery Service Partner programs.

Key Risks: Ongoing antitrust litigation in the U.S., Canada, and UK remains unresolved. The Italian Competition Authority fine of €752 million (reduced from €1.13 billion) is being appealed. Management flagged macroeconomic uncertainty, tariff/trade policy risks, and FX volatility as potential headwinds.

Q4 2025 Guidance: Revenue of $206.0-$213.0 billion (10-13% YoY growth) and operating income of $21.0-$26.0 billion, assuming no additional restructurings or legal settlements."}

parsed_response.summary:
Amazon Q3 2025 Earnings Summary

Overview: Amazon delivered strong top-line growth in Q3 2025, with total net sales of $180.2 billion, up 13% year-over-year (12% excluding FX). Operating income was $17.4 billion, flat versus prior year, though results were impacted by $4.3 billion in special charges: a $2.5 billion FTC legal settlement and $1.8 billion in severance costs related to planned role eliminations. Excluding these charges, operating income would have been $21.7 billion. Diluted EPS was $1.95, up 36% YoY, benefiting from $9.5 billion in pre-tax gains from Anthropic investments.

Segment Performance: AWS re-accelerated to 20% YoY growth, reaching $33.0 billion in revenue with segment operating income of $11.4 billion (35% margin). Management cited strong AI and core infrastructure demand, with 3.8 gigawatts of capacity added in the past 12 months. North America sales grew 11% to $106.3 billion, with operating income of $4.8 billion ($7.3 billion excluding the FTC settlement). International sales increased 14% (10% FX-adjusted) to $40.9 billion with $1.2 billion operating income.

Growth Drivers: Advertising services grew 24% YoY to $17.7 billion. Third-party seller services increased 12% to $42.5 billion. Subscription services rose 11% to $12.6 billion. The company highlighted AI-driven improvements across operations, including Rufus (250 million customers, 60% higher purchase conversion), Trainium2 custom AI chips (150% QoQ growth), and Connect AI contact center solution ($1 billion annualized revenue run rate).

Capital Deployment: Cash capital expenditures reached $34.2 billion in Q3 2025, primarily supporting AWS infrastructure and fulfillment network expansion, with management expecting further increases in 2025-2026. Free cash flow (TTM) declined 69% to $14.8 billion due to accelerated CapEx. The company announced $2.5 billion for Future Ready 2030 workforce training and $1.9 billion investment in Delivery Service Partner programs.

Key Risks: Ongoing antitrust litigation in the U.S., Canada, and UK remains unresolved. The Italian Competition Authority fine of €752 million (reduced from €1.13 billion) is being appealed. Management flagged macroeconomic uncertainty, tariff/trade policy risks, and FX volatility as potential headwinds.

Q4 2025 Guidance: Revenue of $206.0-$213.0 billion (10-13% YoY growth) and operating income of $21.0-$26.0 billion, assuming no additional restructurings or legal settlements.
